content: Can you identify a herbivorous mammal, belonging to the family Elephantidae, that has a unique elongated protrusion from its face, large appendages used for hearing and cooling, and elongated incisors known as tusks, and is frequently observed in the Indian subcontinent?

The animal you are describing is the Indian elephant (Elephas maximus indicus). It is a herbivorous mammal belonging to the family Elephantidae. Indian elephants are known for their unique elongated trunk, large ears which help in hearing and cooling, and elongated incisors called tusks. They are commonly found in the Indian subcontinent and are one of the three recognized subspecies of the Asian elephant.
